definitions.definition: a long straight piece of wood, metal or glass

examples.text: The concrete is reinforced with steel rods.
I finally managed to fix the curtain rods above the windows.
After the accident she had an operation to put strengthening rods in her legs.
He heated the end of the iron rod.
a glass fibre rod 2 or 3 mm in diameter

definitions.definition: a long wooden or plastic stick with a fishing line and hook attached, used for catching fish
a stick that is used for hitting people as a punishment

examples.text: There used to be a saying: ‘Spare the rod and spoil the child.’

definitions.definition: to do something that will cause problems for you in the future
a fact, an argument, etc. that is used in order to blame or punish somebody
to control a person or a group of people very severely

wordOrigin: late Old English rodd ‘slender shoot growing on or cut from a tree’, also ‘straight stick or bundle of twigs used to inflict punishment’; probably related to Old Norse rudda ‘club’.
